threads.text: I like the mobile myself but I have no idea if this company releases kernel sources or allows unlocked bootloaders easily.
I don't know if everybody here thinks wrong, or I am wrong . Honor v10 comes with Oreo out of the box.

Honor v10 comes with oreo and treble support, so you can't even compare that to pre oreo phones that were born with nougat. In theory the treble support and the fact that Huawei released the kernel sources for this phone straight away, should allow for some decent community development

On top of that, I think Huawei was just giving out 100 free devices to willing developers because they want to strenghth the custom rom community for this phone

I think honor really trying to compete with one plus by helping developers by providing all the hardware details and documentation to develop custom Roms for the Honor View 10 and with the treble support soon we will get many custom Roms. I hope developers will take interest in this device.
this bot sucks! :/

Apps open at fast blazing speed. Gaming need some time to open just few seconds difference compared to Snapdragon device. Rest , apps ,social apps everything opens so smooth and fast and also easy in multi tasking

On boor around 3.7/3.8 GB is free and then after using few apps it goes down to 2.2-2.5 Gb free and haven't noticed any lag for anything I throw at it except Facebook app which I strongly believe is application issue and not phone. May be not optimised for EMUI 8 or Oreo amd sucks always. Same issue on any EMUI phone with Facebook

The v10 once again continues the Huawei/honor tradition of implementing swap via zram.

I had 3 GB free RAM and yet it set aside a swap space of 2240 MB and was using 400 MB of it - for no reason.

I wrote the first swap-killing mod for the stock rooted EMUI for the honor US launch and will be providing the same for the new phone. 

Lag spikes hit everywhere and we know from experience that goes away when swap is turned off. 

You have 6 GB RAM and Android has its own app caching service that works a treat. 

Eventually you will run out of RAM on anything. 

It's pointless to live with lag spikes just so that synthetic claims about having 2 GB more virtual memory can be made.

On twitter, Chrome, YouTube and most other apps, scrolling is not as smooth as a Kirin 970 chip should be.

How about you guys?

Is it just me or are there minor stuttering here and there.

My earlier 3t and U11 and even MiA1 were much much smoother.

Kindly reply please.
Do I need to replace the unit or get a refund.

I mean, is this a problem with my unit only or is it widespread?

replies.text: I'm experiencing the same, might be an issue of poor GPU optimization

threads.text: I am experiencing the same while using chrome or even facebook too. Minor stutters here n there. Not smooth as expected. Own this new phone for little more than 24hrs now.

replies.text:
.
.
Thanks...
But this is such a wonderful mobile...
AI features are a boss.

That is not the only issue bugging me. There is the inability to reply to messages from the notification panel itself. Every time I tap on reply to any whatsapp message. It opens the app instead.
This is definitely another bug. Phone itself is fine, but I am regretting not buying the amoled 5T. Since the price was not the factor.

Hmmm...

I'm gonna buy Note 5 pro and wait for OP6

threads.text: I've decided to return it...

it is due to optimization, qualcomn tends to get better support because many phone is using it.

while kirin 970 is a new soc, so it need some time. 

the same thing also happen to samsung exynos or mediatek Soc.

The device does gets warm while playing games,
while playing asphalt 8, PUBG, or Rules of survival like high end games, the temperature maxes out at 43°C indoors. While in casual games,its 40-41.

I noticed heating while charging, it reached once 44 while charging, also, fast charging (with Indian 9V 2A adapter sucks a bit, its too slow, like a 5V 2A charger)

In general, while using camera, yes, it feels warm on back, and while playing games too, but after you are done, it gradually cools down. Heating is under control, pretty normal.

I have a Kirin960 powered P10 Plus, same story. Ice cold, until you put real stress on the CPU.
To be fair, Snapdragon and Kirin both are hotheads. Exynos remains cooler in general. (Though, of course, it also depends on what cooling solution does the manufacturer use.)
It seems this new Honor V10 is equiped with 20MP + 16 MP dual camera, and it has IR blaster? Really interested in it.

At the Honor 9 lite launch event at New Delhi, India, the Honor India team confirmed that the EIS feature is in works for 1080p & 4k videos and would be provided through a OTA. That would help in the low light video capture.

replies.text: are you serious about this? And are you sure the Honor team referring the EIS update for Honor View10 or for the Honor 9 Lite? .. as it is the launching event of Honor 9 lite. Cuz this could be the game-changer for this awesome beast phone. I really want to buy this phone as it costs much lower than the other smartphone in its budget segment but the un-availability of EIS really put me off from the decision ( to buy whether this phone or Oneplus 5T ).
The Honor team recognized lack of EIS as a negative for the view 10 and said that they're working on an EIS feature for at least 1080p video.

threads.text: for the Honor 9 lite (as you mentioning) or the Honor 10 view ?
The view 10 will get the EIS feature. I just confirmed this when I went to the Honor 9 lite launch.

threads.text: I personally asked the Honor India team after the launch event of the Honor 9 lite.

replies.text: Then why they are officially not confirming ? I contact them they thay said there is no official info like this

threads.text: It is not officially disclosed as of now. The people at Honor know that EIS is a big deal when you put the phone next to the OnePlus 5T and they have acknowledged the lack there of. They're working on many things at the moment (more scene recognition options in the camera, more AI features, etc) that they cannot provide ETA for EIS, which people start along once a company promises them some feature. It is in works along with other features and I hope they pull it off.

title: Time to take picture (camera launch speed)

threads.text: I have used OnePlus and Dash Charging is really great. I found honor fast charging take more than 2 hrs to reach 100 % which is still good.
If you are charging and using your Honor View 10 it will take decades to charge : ( but if you just switch off and charge it will get a full charge in hours time.
I use my mate 10 charger and it's way faster than the the original charger
Compare to battery capaciies.. It worth 2 hours.

Awesome battery, easily lasts a full day of usage. Even more if you don't play games. I got 6+ hours of SOT with a day and a half usage (attached screen shots) with WiFi and 4G network always on. This was on my normal usage: calls, SMS, Viber, Emails, web surfing, even YouTube videos and now I have 20% battery juice left. Really thumbs up for this device! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
I think I made a record. Almost 7,5 hours of SOT. 🤘🏻🤘🏻

I love this phone:
After a whole day of useage. With playing game (CR), browsing, installing apps, using a huge amount of different apps, auto brightness on, more than 7h SOT and still 9% battery left! Awesome

I have just one little problem, chrome is almost always active...
Deleted

6 + Hours SOT on Full HD+ Mode and 7-8 Hours SOT on HD+ Resolution mode. with 7-8 hours of standby on 4G

replies.text: I test this device battery performance.

threads.text:
In my case (Firmware Version B130) the View 10 is a battery monster. Normally I have to charge it after 2 to 3 days. 

With heavy usage (mainly youtube, netflix, browsing and hangouts... sorry, I can't upload any Screenshots):

Screen-On Time:            9h28m
System Running Time: 37h34m

-> remaining Battery = 18%

I really ove this phone. Even my beloved LG G2 couldn't reach almost 10h SOT over 1.5 days. 


With normal (browsing, texting, youtube, calls) i get:

Screen-On Time:           7h6m
System Running Time: 49h6m

-> remaining Battery = 23%


...sighs...just loving it <3
Feels really premium, but matte finish on back catches a lot of smudges,so either clean it everytime or use a case.btw feels solid in hands.
Call Quality is excellent!
ive heard that all honor phones have less audio output via aux!! don't know about v10.. maybe due to AI processor it might be better..
Yeah i would like to know about it. Sending back an honor 8 pro mainly because of the low quality audio (in my opinion).
I have bought V10. Audio not great but just okish for casual listening. So does other phones in same price category. I may buy portable external dac/amp . That's the right way to get good audio

threads.text:

am a basshead and used iphone 6 , mi note 4 & lg g3 before.  v10 with sony xb950bt. bt music sounds gr8. with the wire and histen non 3d mode it better. I also use a eq app which works with bt. checked new gen dj songs, bollywood numbers, mj, floyd etc and its good. no distortion but yes bassy. u wont get iphone level clarity but its not also not mi note 4 or 7x ish
